snippet: A legal battle over the work of the photographer Vivian Maier could hide it away for years.
abstract: Court battle over works of photographer Vivian Maier, whose art only became heralded after her death in 2009, may tie her legacy in knots; legal case over determining whether Maier's closest heir is one found by John Maloof, who owns tens of thousands of her negatives, or one found by photographer and lawyer David C Deal, who filed case, could take years and could result in Maier's works being pulled from shows and museums until a determination is made.

byline.contributor: Doreen Carvajal contributed reporting from Paris, and Mitch Smith from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: A legal battle over the work of the photographer Vivian Maier could hide it away for years.

headline.seo: A Legal Battle Over Vivian Maier’s Work
